articles.title: Genie 3: A new frontier for world models
articles.description: Genie 3 can generate dynamic worlds that you can navigate in real time at 24 frames per second, retaining consistency for a few minutes at a resolution of 720p.
articles.content: Genie 3 can generate dynamic worlds that you can navigate in real time at 24 frames per second, retaining consistency for a few minutes at a resolution of 720p.

articles.title: NIH researchers develop AI agent that improves accuracy of gene set analysis by leveraging expert-curated databases
articles.description: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.
articles.content: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.

articles.title: No Backdoors. No Kill Switches. No Spyware.
articles.description: NVIDIA GPUs are at the heart of modern computing. They’re used across industries — from healthcare and finance to scientific research, autonomous systems and AI infrastructure. NVIDIA GPUs are embedded into CT scanners and MRI machines, DNA sequencers, air-traffic radar tracking systems, city traffic-management systems, self-driving cars, supercomputers, TV broadcasting systems, casino machines and game Read Article
articles.author: David Reber Jr.
articles.content: NVIDIA GPUs are at the heart of modern computing. They’re used across industries — from healthcare and finance to scientific research, autonomous systems and AI infrastructure. articles.title: Conformal Prediction Intervals of XGBoost Model: Bitcoin Peaks Amid Coinbase’s Earnings Struggle
articles.description: In the second quarter, Coinbase did not meet Wall Street’s expectations. This decline occurred alongside lower market volatility, despite BTC prices reaching record highs according to Kaiko Research. The chart below indicates that the market priced the aforementioned from August. We can observe a negative decoupling between the Bitcoin ... Continue reading: Conformal Prediction Intervals of XGBoost Model: Bitcoin Peaks Amid Coinbase’s Earnings Struggle

articles.title: Optimal sampling for least-squares approximation
articles.description: arXiv:2409.02342v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Least-squares approximation is one of the most important methods for recovering an unknown function from data. While in many applications the data is fixed, in many others there is substantial freedom to choose where to sample. In this paper, we review recent progress on near-optimal random sampling strategies for (weighted) least-squares approximation in arbitrary linear spaces. We introduce the Christoffel function as a key quantity in the...
articles.author: Ben Adcock
articles.content: arXiv:2409.02342v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Least-squares approximation is one of the most important methods for recovering an unknown function from data. While in many applications the data is fixed, in many others there is substantial freedom to choose where to sample. In this paper, we review recent progress on near-optimal random sampling strategies for (weighted) least-squares approximation in arbitrary linear spaces. We introduce the Christoffel function as a key quantity in the...

articles.title: New NIST Reference Material to Strengthen Quality Control for Biological Drugs
articles.description: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.
articles.author: Sarah Henderson
articles.content: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.

articles.title: Black Hat 2025 shows agentic AI moving from theory to practice
articles.description: At Black Hat 2025, agentic artificial intelligence is demonstrating tangible value within cybersecurity, marking a significant evolution from its largely theoretical presence at Black Hat 2024. This advancement represents a shift towards proactive, autonomous systems that can independently investigate, respond to, and predict potential cyberattacks. This transformation fundamentally alters security operations. Dr. Anya Sharma, Chief […]

articles.title: Smart microscope captures aggregation of misfolded proteins
articles.description: Thematic illustration of smart microscopy for detecting protein aggregation. 2025 Alexey Chizhik/EPFL – CC-BY-SA 4.0. By Celia Luterbacher EPFL researchers have developed a microscope that can be used to predict the onset of misfolded protein aggregation – a hallmark of neurodegenerative disease – as well as analyze the biomechanical properties of these aggregates. The accumulation […]

articles.title: Interview with Aneesh Komanduri: Causality and generative modeling

In this latest interview, we hear from Aneesh Komanduri about his research, some of the projects he’s been involved in, future plans, and his experience at the AAAI/SIGAI Doctoral Consortium. articles.title: Few-Shot Deployment of Pretrained MRI Transformers in Brain Imaging Tasks
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05783v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Machine learning using transformers has shown great potential in medical imaging, but its real-world applicability remains limited due to the scarcity of annotated data. In this study, we propose a practical framework for the few-shot deployment of pretrained MRI transformers in diverse brain imaging tasks. By utilizing the Masked Autoencoder (MAE) pretraining strategy on a large-scale, multi-cohort brain MRI dataset comprising over 31 million...
articles.author: Mengyu Li, Guoyao Shen, Chad W. Farris, Xin Zhang
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05783v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Machine learning using transformers has shown great potential in medical imaging, but its real-world applicability remains limited due to the scarcity of annotated data. In this study, we propose a practical framework for the few-shot deployment of pretrained MRI transformers in diverse brain imaging tasks. By utilizing the Masked Autoencoder (MAE) pretraining strategy on a large-scale, multi-cohort brain MRI dataset comprising over 31 million...

articles.title: Optimization-Free Style Transfer for 3D Gaussian Splats
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05813v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The task of style transfer for 3D Gaussian splats has been explored in many previous works, but these require reconstructing or fine-tuning the splat while incorporating style information or optimizing a feature extraction network on the splat representation. We propose a reconstruction- and optimization-free approach to stylizing 3D Gaussian splats. This is done by generating a graph structure across the implicit surface of the splat...
articles.author: Raphael Du Sablon, David Hart
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05813v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The task of style transfer for 3D Gaussian splats has been explored in many previous works, but these require reconstructing or fine-tuning the splat while incorporating style information or optimizing a feature extraction network on the splat representation. We propose a reconstruction- and optimization-free approach to stylizing 3D Gaussian splats. This is done by generating a graph structure across the implicit surface of the splat...

articles.title: Holistic Explainable AI (H-XAI): Extending Transparency Beyond Developers in AI-Driven Decision Making
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05792v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current eXplainable AI (XAI) methods largely serve developers, often focusing on justifying model outputs rather than supporting diverse stakeholder needs. A recent shift toward Evaluative AI reframes explanation as a tool for hypothesis testing, but still focuses primarily on operational organizations. We introduce Holistic-XAI (H-XAI), a unified framework that integrates causal rating methods with traditional XAI methods to support explanation...
articles.author: Kausik Lakkaraju, Siva Likitha Valluru, Biplav Srivastava
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05792v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current eXplainable AI (XAI) methods largely serve developers, often focusing on justifying model outputs rather than supporting diverse stakeholder needs. A recent shift toward Evaluative AI reframes explanation as a tool for hypothesis testing, but still focuses primarily on operational organizations. We introduce Holistic-XAI (H-XAI), a unified framework that integrates causal rating methods with traditional XAI methods to support explanation...

articles.title: Optimal Linear Baseline Models for Scientific Machine Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05831v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Across scientific domains, a fundamental challenge is to characterize and compute the mappings from underlying physical processes to observed signals and measurements. While nonlinear neural networks have achieved considerable success, they remain theoretically opaque, which hinders adoption in contexts where interpretability is paramount. In contrast, linear neural networks serve as a simple yet effective foundation for gaining insight into these...
articles.author: Alexander DeLise, Kyle Loh, Krish Patel, Meredith Teague, Andrea Arnold, Matthias Chung
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05831v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Across scientific domains, a fundamental challenge is to characterize and compute the mappings from underlying physical processes to observed signals and measurements. While nonlinear neural networks have achieved considerable success, they remain theoretically opaque, which hinders adoption in contexts where interpretability is paramount. In contrast, linear neural networks serve as a simple yet effective foundation for gaining insight into these...

articles.title: A Markov Decision Process Framework for Early Maneuver Decisions in Satellite Collision Avoidance
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05876v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This work presents a Markov decision process (MDP) framework to model decision-making for collision avoidance maneuver (CAM) and a reinforcement learning policy gradient (RL-PG) algorithm to train an autonomous guidance policy using historic CAM data. In addition to maintaining acceptable collision risks, this approach seeks to minimize the average fuel consumption of CAMs by making early maneuver decisions. We model CAM as a continuous state,...
articles.author: Francesca Ferrara, Lander W. Schillinger Arana, Florian D\"orfler, Sarah H. Q. Li
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05876v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This work presents a Markov decision process (MDP) framework to model decision-making for collision avoidance maneuver (CAM) and a reinforcement learning policy gradient (RL-PG) algorithm to train an autonomous guidance policy using historic CAM data. In addition to maintaining acceptable collision risks, this approach seeks to minimize the average fuel consumption of CAMs by making early maneuver decisions. We model CAM as a continuous state,...

articles.title: IOCC: Aligning Semantic and Cluster Centers for Few-shot Short Text Clustering
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06126v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In clustering tasks, it is essential to structure the feature space into clear, well-separated distributions. However, because short text representations have limited expressiveness, conventional methods struggle to identify cluster centers that truly capture each category's underlying semantics, causing the representations to be optimized in suboptimal directions. To address this issue, we propose IOCC, a novel few-shot contrastive learning...
articles.author: Jixuan Yin, Zhihao Yao, Wenshuai Huo, Xinmiao Yu, Xiaocheng Feng, Bo Li
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06126v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In clustering tasks, it is essential to structure the feature space into clear, well-separated distributions. However, because short text representations have limited expressiveness, conventional methods struggle to identify cluster centers that truly capture each category's underlying semantics, causing the representations to be optimized in suboptimal directions. To address this issue, we propose IOCC, a novel few-shot contrastive learning...

articles.title: Generalization Bound for Diffusion Models using Random Features
articles.description: arXiv:2310.04417v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Diffusion probabilistic models have been successfully used to generate data from noise. However, most diffusion models are computationally expensive and difficult to interpret with a lack of theoretical justification. Random feature models on the other hand have gained popularity due to their interpretability but their application to complex machine learning tasks remains limited. In this work, we present a diffusion model-inspired deep random...
articles.author: Esha Saha, Giang Tran
articles.content: arXiv:2310.04417v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Diffusion probabilistic models have been successfully used to generate data from noise. However, most diffusion models are computationally expensive and difficult to interpret with a lack of theoretical justification. Random feature models on the other hand have gained popularity due to their interpretability but their application to complex machine learning tasks remains limited. In this work, we present a diffusion model-inspired deep random...

articles.title: MZEN: Multi-Zoom Enhanced NeRF for 3-D Reconstruction with Unknown Camera Poses
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05819v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) methods excel at 3D reconstruction from multiple 2D images, even those taken with unknown camera poses. However, they still miss the fine-detailed structures that matter in industrial inspection, e.g., detecting sub-micron defects on a production line or analyzing chips with Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM). In these scenarios, the sensor resolution is fixed and compute budgets are tight, so the only way to expose...
articles.author: Jong-Ik Park, Carlee Joe-Wong, Gary K. Fedder
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05819v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) methods excel at 3D reconstruction from multiple 2D images, even those taken with unknown camera poses. However, they still miss the fine-detailed structures that matter in industrial inspection, e.g., detecting sub-micron defects on a production line or analyzing chips with Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM). In these scenarios, the sensor resolution is fixed and compute budgets are tight, so the only way to expose...

articles.title: Improving Masked Style Transfer using Blended Partial Convolution
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05769v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artistic style transfer has long been possible with the advancements of convolution- and transformer-based neural networks. Most algorithms apply the artistic style transfer to the whole image, but individual users may only need to apply a style transfer to a specific region in the image. The standard practice is to simply mask the image after the stylization. This work shows that this approach tends to improperly capture the style features in the...
articles.author: Seyed Hadi Seyed, Ayberk Cansever, David Hart
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05769v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artistic style transfer has long been possible with the advancements of convolution- and transformer-based neural networks. Most algorithms apply the artistic style transfer to the whole image, but individual users may only need to apply a style transfer to a specific region in the image. The standard practice is to simply mask the image after the stylization. This work shows that this approach tends to improperly capture the style features in the...

articles.title: Mitigating Think-Answer Mismatch in LLM Reasoning Through Noise-Aware Advantage Reweighting
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05928v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Group-Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) is a key technique for training large reasoning models, yet it suffers from a critical vulnerability: the \emph{Think-Answer Mismatch}, where noisy reward signals corrupt the learning process. This problem is most severe in unbalanced response groups, paradoxically degrading the signal precisely when it should be most informative. To address this challenge, we propose Stable Group-Relative Policy...
articles.author: Si Shen, Peijun Shen, Wenhua Zhao, Danhao Zhu
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05928v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Group-Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) is a key technique for training large reasoning models, yet it suffers from a critical vulnerability: the \emph{Think-Answer Mismatch}, where noisy reward signals corrupt the learning process. This problem is most severe in unbalanced response groups, paradoxically degrading the signal precisely when it should be most informative. To address this challenge, we propose Stable Group-Relative Policy...
